To recall apostates to repentance who had repudiated their legitimate wives, and abjured religion, was a still more arduous business Yet to show you how powerfully the compassion of God was exerted on this occa- sion, none of them departed this life without receiving baptism, except one woman, who, when first attacked by the disorder, resisted my exhortations that she would undergo that ceremony, denying that she was in any imme- diate danger. Having found, from experience, that the fatal period of this disorder amongst the Abipones was not in its rise, but in its pro- gress, Ι thought proper to yield to the entreaties of both husband and wife, and returned home in the firm determination of soon re-visiting my patient. But, alas ! scarce a quarter of an hour had elapsed, when, to my great sorrow, Ι heard that she had suddenly expired.
